title: Microsoft.VisualBasic.Core.Tests fail on Android

author: radical
body:
Failing tests:
```
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F2", arguments: [1, -1], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 1, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F3", arguments: [1, 2, -1], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 2, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F4", arguments: [1, 2, 3, -1], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 3, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F5", arguments: [1, 2, 3, 4, -1], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 4, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F6", arguments: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ...], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 5, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F7", arguments: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ...], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 6, -1")
Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F8", arguments: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ...], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 7, -1")
```

.. failing with errors like:

```
[10:34:43] fail: [FAIL] Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(memberName: "F2", arguments: [1, -1], typeArguments: null, expectedValue: "System.Int32, 1, -1")
[10:34:43] info: System.InvalidCastException : Overload resolution failed because no Public 'F2' can be called with these arguments:
[10:34:43] info:     'Public Function F2(Of Integer)([p1 As Integer = Nothing], [p2 As System.Nullable(Of Integer) = 2]) As System.Object':
[10:34:43] info:         Argument matching parameter 'p2' cannot convert from 'Integer' to 'Nullable(Of Integer)'.
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.OverloadResolution.ResolveOverloadedCall(String methodName, List`1 candidates, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Type[] typeArguments, BindingFlags lookupFlags, Boolean reportErrors, ResolutionFailure& failure)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.OverloadResolution.ResolveOverloadedCall(String methodName, MemberInfo[] members, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Type[] typeArguments, BindingFlags lookupFlags, Boolean reportErrors, ResolutionFailure& failure, Container baseReference)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.NewLateBinding.ResolveCall(Container baseReference, String methodName, MemberInfo[] members, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Type[] typeArguments, BindingFlags lookupFlags, Boolean reportErrors, ResolutionFailure& failure)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.NewLateBinding.CallMethod(Container baseReference, String methodName, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Type[] typeArguments, Boolean[] copyBack, BindingFlags invocationFlags, Boolean reportErrors, ResolutionFailure& failure)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.NewLateBinding.ObjectLateCall(Object instance, Type type, String memberName, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Type[] typeArguments, Boolean[] copyBack, Boolean ignoreReturn)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.NewLateBinding.FallbackCall(Object Instance, String MemberName, Object[] Arguments, String[] ArgumentNames, Boolean IgnoreReturn)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.IDOUtils.CreateRefCallSiteAndInvoke(CallSiteBinder action, Object instance, Object[] arguments)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.IDOBinder.IDOCall(IDynamicMetaObjectProvider instance, String memberName, Object[] arguments, String[] argumentNames, Boolean[] copyBack, Boolean ignoreReturn)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.NewLateBinding.LateCall(Object Instance, Type Type, String MemberName, Object[] Arguments, String[] ArgumentNames, Type[] TypeArguments, Boolean[] CopyBack, Boolean IgnoreReturn)
[10:34:43] info:    at Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Tests.NewLateBindingTests.LateCall_OptionalValues(String memberName, Object[] arguments, Type[] typeArguments, String expectedValue)

```

title: [trimming] Failing tests with trimming - Microsoft.VisualBasic.Core.Tests

author: AlexRadch
body:
### Description

When the current culture is not English, then  Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.StringsTests.Asc_Chr_Invariant fail tests on net48 with next log:
```
 Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.StringsTests.Asc_Chr_Invariant
   Source: StringsTests.cs line 121

Test has multiple result outcomes
   3 Passed
   1 Failed

Results
    4)   Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.StringsTests.Asc_Chr_Invariant(charCode: 255, expected: 255) 
      Duration: 19 ms

      Message: 
Assert.Equal() Failure
Expected: 255
Actual:   121

      Stack Trace: 
StringsTests.Asc_Chr_Invariant(Int32 charCode, Int32 expected) line 127
```

`Strings.Asc()` returns 211 but 255 is expected. Unfortunately, I don't know how to debug inside it to make PR. 
Can anyone give me a link with help on how to compile tests with a possibility to debug inside library methods?

### Configuration

net48 target
Windows 10 (Russian)
x64

nodes.author: danmoseley
nodes.body:
@AlexRadch I would expect it to just work. There are several ways to debug tests, eg.,
* the console output says to pushd to a folder and then run a certain command line. You can set up your debugger to launch that command line in that folder and set a breakpoint.
* or, you can add a `Debugger.Break()` command and then attach
* or, it's supposed to work to start debugging the test from the Test Explorer but I have not tried this recently especially for .NET Framework 4.8 target

For such a simple test, it may be easier to paste the code into a standalone app targeting .NET Framework.  If you have disabled "Just my Code" and enabled "Step into .NET Framework" and "Use Microsoft symbol server" it should load the symbols for Microsoft.VisualBasic.dll and allow you to step into the code.

If this only repros for .NET Framework target and .NET Core another option is to use ILSPY and just compare the implementations of Strings.Asc and Strings.Chr. Or transliterate what you see in ILSPY into C# and debug that, etc etc.

nodes.author: tarekgh
nodes.body:
@AlexRadch I tried running with default culture as Russian culture but couldn't get this specific failure. Are you consistently getting this failure on your machine? For testing you may follow the instructions in the link https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/workflow/testing/visualstudio.md

I got other failures though because the `NaN` symbol for this language is defined as `не число`. Here is an example of the failures:

```
      Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.ConversionsTests.ToString_IConvertible_ReturnsExpected(value: ?? ?????, expected: "NaN") [FAIL]
        Assert.Equal() Failure
        Expected: NaN
        Actual:   ?? ?????
        Stack Trace:
          C:\oss\runtime\src\libraries\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Core\tests\ConversionsTests.cs(2874,0): at Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.ConversionsTests.AssertEqual(Object expected, Object actual)
          C:\oss\runtime\src\libraries\Microsoft.VisualBasic.Core\tests\ConversionsTests.cs(2689,0): at Microsoft.VisualBasic.Tests.ConversionsTests.ToString_IConvertible_ReturnsExpected(IConvertible value, String expected)
```


CC @tannergooding

nodes.author: tannergooding
nodes.body:
@tarekgh I beleive that should be expected. We rely on `NumberFormatInfo.NaNSymbol`: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/78593b9e095f974305b2033b465455e458e30267/src/libraries/System.Private.CoreLib/src/System/Number.Parsing.cs#L1804-L1815

If you want just "NaN" to work, you'd need to use the `InvariantCulture`.

nodes.author: tarekgh
nodes.body:
@tannergooding you are right. I just cc'ed for awareness. The test needs to be fixed. 


@danmoseley @AlexRadch 

The issue here is on NETFX 4.8, `Microsoft.VisualBasic.Strings.Asc()` calls the following:

```C#
Encoding fileIOEncoding = Utils.GetFileIOEncoding();
```

And `GetFileIOEncoding` implemented as follows:

```C#
// Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Utils
internal static Encoding GetFileIOEncoding()
{
	return Encoding.Default;
}
```

That will cause always use the system encoding regardless of the current culture.


On net core, `Microsoft.VisualBasic.Strings.Asc()` calls the following:

```C#
enc = GetAscChrEncoding()
```

and `GetAscChrEncoding` implemented as:

```VB
        Private Function GetAscChrEncoding() As Encoding
            Return Encoding.GetEncoding(GetLocaleCodePage())
        End Function

        Friend Shared Function GetLocaleCodePage() As Integer
            Return System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture.TextInfo.ANSICodePage
        End Function
```

which return the encoding from the current culture and not the system one.

The test need to be fixed to support such case.

title: Asc_Chr_Invariant fail tests on net48 with current culture is not English

author: vsfeedback
body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Visual-Studio-2022-Community-Shell-Funct/10410747)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
The following code executes without error in Visual Studio 2019

 Shell("powershell c:\SystemCommon\Scripts\CollectHistoricalVersionFolders.ps1", AppWinStyle.Hide, True)

In VS 2022 Community, the step just blows right thru the line, returning powershell is not a valid program.
This happens with powershell.exe and with the full path specified.

I added -command at the suggestion of another post (although I never needed it in 2019), resulting in the same error.

Is there a path that I need to set up for my project's execution that differs from what "path" returns in cmd (powershell is in that)?

If so, how do I accomplish that?

Or is it something else?

---

title: Visual Studio 2022 Community Shell Function runtime error

author: vsfeedback
body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/StrConvtextVbStrConvProperCase-cau/10519912)._

---
[severity:It bothers me. A fix would be nice]
I converted my app from .net framework to .NET 6 which resulted in thousands of errors.
I deleted all references to menus that elimated several problems. I'm working a workaround for them as I was phasing them out anyway.
I found a solution to 1 set and a workaround for another.
This one has me puzzled since I changed all my code that was using Chr() and Asc() that was previously causing an 'encoding 1252' error 
    to ChrW() and AscW() that doesn't cause an error on any of my lines of code.

The code that triggers the error now is 

        For Each name As String In Data_Text_string_array
            If name.Length > 1 Then
                Try
                    ListBox_Data.Items.Add(StrConv(Function_Name_Full_string(name), VbStrConv.ProperCase))  <-- triggers the error
                Catch
                    MsgBox(Err.Description)
                    ListBox_Data.Items.Add(Function_Name_Full_string(name))
                End Try
                count += 1
                Names_Writers_string_array(count) = name
            End If
        Next

The MsgBox doesn't even appear, so my code can't catch it.
I can't use similar coding for now.

Changing the code as follows works, so I'll have to create a Function to replace it.

        For Each name As String In Data_Text_string_array
            If name.Length > 1 Then
                    ListBox_Data.Items.Add(Function_Name_Full_string(name))
                count += 1
                Names_Writers_string_array(count) = name
            End If
        Next


---

(private comment, text removed)

title: StrConv("text",VbStrConv.ProperCase) causes a confusing error error
